Clue: Supernova generate lots of heat
<color=orange>Excavation Site</color>
1
ROOT: Goodness! Why have you delivered such a large chunk of ice to our <color=orange>Volcanic Testing Site</color> today, Clary? I am surprised it has not already melted in this heat!
2
1
CLARY: Isn't it marvelous? This spherical chunk of ice was taken from an asteroid belt far outside the star system for sample testing.. I brought it back to study its properties further!
3
2
CLARY: Formed in the cold depths outside the star system, it seems to have a much higher melting point than ordinary ice.. though of course, it does not compare to the ore we are testing!
4
3
CLARY: I brought it today because I thought it would be perfect to seal aboard the <color=orange>diving bell</color> for our final test of the ore's durability today!
5
4
ROOT: A wise idea, Clary! With the ice stored within it, we should be able to easily tell if the <color=orange>diving bell's</color> protective shell was able to adequately insulate heat from its interior.
6
5
ROOT: Now, let us seal the <color=orange>diving bell</color> completely, before we lower it into the lava pool's deepest point!
7
6
ROOT: Afterwards, we shall raise it and let it cool - before finally penetrating the protective shell to reveal the results of this test.
